summary: Employees at the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) counter terrorism, provide airplane and border security, and respond to emergencies (among other critical functions). Federal surveys have consistently found that DHS employees are less satisfied with their jobs than the average federal worker. In response, DHS has been working to increase employee morale—e.g., by improving access to benefits and resources. We testified that DHS has made...
title: Department of Homeland Security: Employee Morale Survey Scores Highlight Progress and Continued Challenges
